ReportSection.ReportItem:
Partners
Please list current identified and potential partners for your CAT proposal and provide the (estimated) amount of cash or in-kind contribution they will be providing. Additional partners can be added in the final proposal. {$item}

Keywords
(Max. 10 words that describe Proposal (e.g. Medline headings) {$item}

Non-Confidential Project Summary Background, Knowledge Gap(s) and Rationale
  • Clearly state the rationale for the project and specifically how the research findings of this proposal may be used to improve the care of older Canadians living with frailty and improve the lives of their family, friends and caregivers.
 {$item}

Hypothesis
  • State the proposed hypothesis and study question(s) to be addressed.
 {$item}

Overall Goal, Study Question(s) and Objective(s)
  • Describe the overall goal of the study,
  • Describe the specific questions to be answered and/or objectives of the study.
 {$item}

Methodological Approach
  • Describe the overall goal of the study,
  • Briefly describe the overall study design and methods to be used in the study.
    Note: Please indicate the frailty assessment tool that will be utilized in the study.
 {$item}

Study Outcomes and Deliverables
  • Briefly list and describe all anticipated outputs and outcomes for the duration of the project.
 {$item}

Study Outcomes and Deliverables
  • Identify any feasibility issues, barriers, challenges and/or limitations to the successful execution of the study.
 {$item}

Expertise and Experience of Study team
  • Briefly describe the expertise and experience of the Principal Investigators, Co-investigators, and Partners as they relate to the successful completion of the proposed study
 {$item}

Potential Impact and Knowledge Translation
  • Describe the potential impact of the anticipated study results (i.e., socio-economic benefits related to the care of Canadians living with frailty) and the knowledge translation activities that will be conducted at the end of the study.
 {$item}

ReportItem.options: How can health systems be organized to provide integrated/coordinated care that would better meet the health and social care needs of older adults living with frailty, and their family/caregivers?|How can care, services and treatments be tailored to meet the needs of older adults living with frailty who are isolated and/or without family/caregiver support or advocates?|What is the impact of community- and home-based services, programs and resources in preventing and managing frailty (including slowing progression and/or minimizing the impact of frailty)?|What are the costs and benefits of alternative models of housing, including multigenerational or shared living, for older adults living with frailty?|What would help avoid unnecessary hospitalizations and emergency department visits for older adults living with frailty?|What frailty-related attitudes, skills and knowledge should health and social care providers have? What are effective ways of improving attitudes and providing skills and knowledge about frailty for health and social care providers?|What would help older adults living with frailty and their family/caregivers recognize when living at home is no longer viable?|What are effective ways of supporting family/caregivers of older adults living with frailty to maintain their own health and wellbeing and/or that of older adults living with frailty?|How can frailty measures be used by health care practitioners, older adults and family/caregivers to inform treatment and care decisions?|What is the impact of exercise and physical activity (including type, duration and intensity) in preventing and managing frailty (including slowing progression and/or minimizing the impact of frailty)?
